Cameras

Description

Cameras in the Virtual Self Driving Car Studio are used for observing the workspace from different views and taking images. Cameras are considered “actors” in the Virtual Self Driving Car Studio. The camera library controls the camera actors.

A camera must be initialized first by spawning the camera in the location (or attached to the parent actor of choice) in order to use it.

See the Camera Tutorial to get a better understanding of using cameras in the Quanser Interactive Labs.

Camera Library

class library_qlabs_free_camera.QLabsFreeCamera[source]

This class supports the spawning and control of free movement cameras in QLabs open worlds.

Constants

QLabsFreeCamera.ID_FREE_CAMERA = 170

Class ID

QLabsFreeCamera.FCN_FREE_CAMERA_POSSESS = 10
QLabsFreeCamera.FCN_FREE_CAMERA_POSSESS_ACK = 11
QLabsFreeCamera.FCN_FREE_CAMERA_SET_CAMERA_PROPERTIES = 12
QLabsFreeCamera.FCN_FREE_CAMERA_SET_CAMERA_PROPERTIES_ACK = 13
QLabsFreeCamera.FCN_FREE_CAMERA_SET_TRANSFORM = 14
QLabsFreeCamera.FCN_FREE_CAMERA_SET_TRANSFORM_ACK = 15
QLabsFreeCamera.FCN_FREE_CAMERA_SET_IMAGE_RESOLUTION = 90
QLabsFreeCamera.FCN_FREE_CAMERA_SET_IMAGE_RESOLUTION_RESPONSE = 91
QLabsFreeCamera.FCN_FREE_CAMERA_REQUEST_IMAGE = 100
QLabsFreeCamera.FCN_FREE_CAMERA_RESPONSE_IMAGE = 101

Methods

QLabsFreeCamera.spawn(qlabs, actorNumber, location, rotation)[source]

Spawns a camera in an instance of QLabs at a specific location and rotation using radians.

Parameters

  • qlabs (object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

  • location (float array[3]) – An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates

  • rotation (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, and yaw

Returns

0 if successful, 1 class not available, 2 actor number not available or already in use, 3 unknown error, -1 communications error

Return type

int32

QLabsFreeCamera.spawn_degrees(qlabs, actorNumber, location, rotation)[source]

Spawns a camera in an instance of QLabs at a specific location and rotation using degrees.

Parameters

  • qlabs (object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

  • location (float array[3]) – An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates

  • rotation (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, and yaw

Returns

0 if successful, 1 class not available, 2 actor number not available or already in use, 3 unknown error, -1 communications error

Return type

int32

QLabsFreeCamera.spawn_and_parent_with_relative_transform(qlabs, actorNumber, location, rotation, parentClassID, parentActorNumber, parentComponent)[source]

Spawns a camera in an instance of QLabs at a specific location and rotation relative to the parent actor using radians.

Parameters

  • qlabs (object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

  • location (array[3]) – An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates

  • rotation (array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, yaw

  • parentClassID (uint32) – Parent class ID (Can be found in the class library)

  • parentActorNumber (uint32) – The unique actorNumber identifier for the parent class in QLabs

  • ParentComponent (uint32) – 0 for the origin of the parent actor, see the parent class for additional reference frame options

Returns

0 if successful, 1 class not available, 2 actor number not available or already in use, 3 cannot find the parent actor, 4 unknown error, -1 communications error

Return type

int32

QLabsFreeCamera.spawn_and_parent_with_relative_transform_degrees(qlabs, actorNumber, location, rotation, parentClassID, parentActorNumber, parentComponent)[source]

Spawns a camera in an instance of QLabs at a specific location and rotation relative to the parent actor using degrees.

Parameters

  • qlabs (object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

  • location (array[3]) – An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates

  • rotation (array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, yaw

  • parentClassID (uint32) – Parent class ID (Can be found in the class library)

  • parentActorNumber (uint32) – The unique actorNumber identifier for the parent class in QLabs

  • ParentComponent (uint32) – 0 for the origin of the parent actor, see the parent class for additional reference frame options

Returns

0 if successful, 1 class not available, 2 actor number not available or already in use, 3 cannot find the parent actor, 4 unknown error, -1 communications error

Return type

int32

QLabsFreeCamera.possess(qlabs, actorNumber)[source]

Possess (take control of) a camera in QLabs.

Parameters

  • qlabs (object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

Returns

True if possessing the camera was successful, False otherwise

Return type

boolean

QLabsFreeCamera.set_camera_properties(qlabs, actorNumber, fieldOfView, depthOfField, aperature, focusDistance)[source]

Sets the camera properties.

Parameters

  • qlabs (object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

  • fieldOfView – The field of view that the camera can see (range:5-150)

  • depthOfField – The depth of feild that the camera can see

  • aperature – The amount of light allowed into the camera sensor (range:2.0-22.0)

  • focusDistance – The focus distance that the camera can see (range:0.1-50.0)

Returns

True if setting the camera properties was successful, False otherwise

Return type

boolean

QLabsFreeCamera.set_transform(qlabs, actorNumber, location, rotation)[source]

Change the location and rotation of a spawned camera in radians

Parameters

  • qlabs (object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

  • location (array[3]) – An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates

  • rotation (array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, yaw in radians

Returns

True if spawn was successful, False otherwise

Return type

boolean

QLabsFreeCamera.set_transform_degrees(qlabs, actorNumber, location, rotation)[source]

Change the location and rotation of a spawned camera in degrees

Parameters

  • qlabs (object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

  • location (array[3]) – An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates

  • rotation (array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, yaw in degrees

Returns

True if spawn was successful, False otherwise

Return type

boolean

QLabsFreeCamera.destroy(qlabs, actorNumber)[source]

Destroys a camera in an instance of QLabs.

Parameters

  • qlabs (QuanserInteractiveLabs object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

Returns

The number of actors destroyed. -1 if failed.

Return type

int32

QLabsFreeCamera.ping(qlabs, actorNumber)[source]

Checks if a camera of the corresponding actor number exists in the QLabs environment.

Parameters

  • qlabs (QuanserInteractiveLabs object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

Returns

True if spawn was successful, False otherwise

Return type

boolean

QLabsFreeCamera.get_world_transform(qlabs, actorNumber)[source]

Get the location, rotation, and scale in world coordinates of the camera

Parameters

  • qlabs (QuanserInteractiveLabs object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object.

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

Returns

success, location, rotation, scale

Return type

boolean, float array[3], float array[3], float array[3]

QLabsFreeCamera.set_image_capture_resolution(qlabs, actorNumber, width=640, height=480)[source]

Change the default width and height of image resolution for capture

Parameters

  • qlabs (QuanserInteractiveLabs object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object.

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

  • width (uint32) – Must be an even number. Default 640

  • height (uint32) – Must be an even number. Default 480

Returns

True if spawn was successful, False otherwise

Return type

boolean

QLabsFreeCamera.get_image(qlabs, actorNumber)[source]

Request an image from the camera actor. Note, set_image_capture_resolution must be set once per camera otherwise this method will fail.

Parameters

  • qlabs (QuanserInteractiveLabs object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object.

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

Returns

Success, RGB image data

Return type

boolean, byte array[variable]

Configurations

There are no configuration options for the camera actor.

Connection Points

There are no connection points for the free camera actor.

Camera Tutorial

Example 1
Example 2
Example 3

Tip

There is a few easy steps to initializing a new camera in an environment using the interface as well as the code:

  1. Pick a Location for your camera using the Coordinate Helper (Determining Locations) section.

  2. Copy the location and rotation desired.

  3. Use spawn or spawn_degrees to initialize a new camera. Paste the copied location and rotation into their respective places.
